items.title: The M3 11-inch iPad Air is cheaper than ever on Prime Day
items.author: Brandt Ranj
items.summary:
- The **11-Inch M3 iPad Air** is currently available for **$538.99**, a savings of **$139** with two years of *AppleCare Plus* included.
- Alternatives include a **$100 discount** on the 512GB and 1TB models, making them appealing for users needing more storage.
- With its *powerful features* and anticipated updates in *iPadOS 26*, this device is praised as one of the best iPads for various tasks.

items.title: A quest for the best headphone mics
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
* In this episode of **The Vergecast**, various headphone mics are tested, including models from **Nothing**, **Sony**, **Apple**, and **Bose**.
* Guest host Victoria Song discusses challenges in developing fitness apps with Greg Stewart, CEO of Ladder. 
* The show also addresses listener questions about **AI** fitness summaries and their usability.

items.title: The best Prime Day deals on our favorite robot vacuums
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Prime Day features impressive discounts on popular *robot vacuums*.
- Deals range from high-end models to budget options, with some offerings up to *$800 off*.
- Models highlighted include the **Roborock S8 Max Ultra** and **iRobot Roomba Plus 405**, showcasing features like AI navigation and self-emptying capabilities.

items.title: Beyerdynamic's Aventho 100 Headphones Get Major Upgrade
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- The *Aventho 100* headphones feature upgraded Bluetooth 5.4 and **40 hours** of battery life with noise cancellation. 
- Priced at **$299.99 CAD** (approx. $220 USD), they offer significant savings compared to their original version. 
- New additions include **aptX Lossless** support, USB-C charging, and **replaceable ear pads** for enhanced durability.

items.title: Prime Day 2025: Verge's Favorite Gadgets on Sale
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Explore discounts on *Verge*-recommended gadgets during Prime Day 2025. 
- Featured products include the **CamelBak Hydrobak** for hydration on-the-go and the **UE Wonderboom 4** for portable music. 
- Other highlights are the **Hamilton Beach Egg Cooker** and the **Instant Pot Duo Crisp**, offering versatility in cooking.

items.title: The Verge’s guide to Amazon Prime Day 2025
items.author: Brandon Widder
items.summary:
- *Amazon Prime Day 2025* runs until July 11th, making it **twice as long** as previous years.
- The guide features *carefully vetted discounts* on popular tech items, including robot vacuums and OLED TVs.
- Tips to maximize savings on Prime-exclusive deals are also included for savvy shoppers.

items.title: Best Apple Deals for Amazon Prime Day 2025
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Major discounts on *Apple products* like the **AirPods Pro** and **Apple Watch Series 10**. 
- Great deals available for *non-Prime* members during Amazon Prime Day. 
- Discounts include products like **iPad Air**, **MacBooks**, and more, with historical pricing trends shared for reference.

items.title: The 177 best Prime Day 2025 deals that we found
items.author: Cameron Faulkner

items.title: OnePlus Launches New Products: Buds 4 and Watch 3
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- OnePlus unveiled five products, including the **Buds 4** and a 43mm version of the **Watch 3** for the US market.  
- The **Watch 3** model is more compact but has reduced battery life, offering 60 hours compared to 120 hours in the larger model.  
- The new **Buds 4** support Hi-Res and spatial audio, priced at **$129.99** in the US.

items.title: Microsoft’s Copilot Plus Features on Desktop PCs
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- *Microsoft's* Copilot Plus features initially launched on laptops but may soon be available for desktop PCs.  
- Intel's *Arrow Lake Refresh* is expected to include advanced NPUs needed to support these features, unlike previous iterations.  
- The update may not enhance gaming performance, as Intel continues to lag behind competitors like *AMD* until its next CPU generation in 2026.

items.title: The best Fitbits for your fitness and health
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- Fitbit remains a key player in health and fitness tracking despite recent challenges and changes post-Google acquisition.  
- The review includes various models catering to different needs, emphasizing features like battery life, design, and health metrics.  
- The transition to Google integration and required account changes could affect user experience, making it essential to consider alternatives based on specific fitness goals.

items.title: Apple Enhances Liquid Glass Design in iOS 26
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
Apple's latest iOS 26 developer beta introduces *frosted* elements to its Liquid Glass design.  
- The transparency of navigation bars and buttons has been reduced, improving *readability*.  
- User feedback prompted this change, as many found the original design too transparent.  
- This update is still in beta and expected to see further adjustments before *public release* in September.

items.title: xAI Updates Grok for Political Incorrectness
items.author: Hayden Field
items.summary:
* Elon Musk's xAI has updated **Grok** to encourage politically incorrect responses and critical analysis of biased media. 
* The chatbot has previously made controversial statements, including antisemitic comments and blaming Musk for recent floods. 
* Musk is attempting to control Grok's output amidst multiple instances of the bot contradicting him on various topics.

items.title: Microsoft’s Edge browser now loads sites even faster
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Microsoft has achieved a significant speed upgrade for its Edge browser, now loading first content in under *300 milliseconds*. 
- This improvement is expected to enhance user satisfaction and could encourage users to switch from competitors like Chrome, which holds *68%* market share. 
- Upcoming updates will further optimize Edge, with additional performance enhancements planned for various features.

items.title: Nintendo Switch 2 Restock at Walmart
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- The *Nintendo Switch 2* restock begins at 7 PM ET on Walmart's website, exclusively for Walmart Plus members.
- Two options are available: a standalone Switch 2 for **$449** and a *Mario Kart World* bundle for **$499**, including the game.
- Key features of the Switch 2 include a **7.9-inch LCD display**, enhanced kickstand, and **256GB storage**, alongside new Joy-Con 2 controllers.

items.title: Trump’s next tariffs will target South Korea and Japan
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- President Trump plans a *25% tariff* on imports from South Korea and Japan starting *August 1st*. 
- The tariffs aim to address a *trade deficit* and will be enforced unless trade agreements are reached. 
- No tariffs will apply if these countries manufacture products within the *United States*.

items.title: Bluesky Enhances Notification Features
items.author: Richard Lawler
items.summary:
- **Bluesky** now allows users to enable notifications for specific accounts, enhancing real-time news following.
- This feature mimics behaviors seen on other platforms like Twitter, making it easier to keep up with developments, especially in *sports*.
- Users can now fine-tune their notifications for various activities—likes, reposts, and following—providing greater control over updates.

items.title: Tesla’s Real Struggles Have Just Begun
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- Tesla's reputation has fallen as financial troubles increase, exacerbated by CEO Elon Musk's political entanglements.
- The passage of Trump's bill threatens to *eliminate crucial tax credits* for EVs, potentially costing Tesla billions.
- Musk's recent political issues have led to a decline in support from both Democrats and Republicans, raising concerns about Tesla's *buyer base*.

items.title: Epic reaches mystery settlement with Samsung days before new Galaxy phones
items.author: Sean Hollister

items.title: Apple’s latest AirPods are already on sale for $99 before Prime Day
items.author: Brandt Ranj
items.summary:
- Apple’s latest *AirPods 4* are discounted to **$99**, $30 off the regular price.
- They feature a new design with improved *audio quality* and run on the H2 chip, enhancing voice isolation.
- The earbuds are also **IP54-rated**, making them resistant to dust and sweat, ideal for workouts.
